Description.Name: Han "The Iron Khan" Hill
Description.Details:
Khan Han Hill, also known as "The Iron Khan", is one of Clan Coyote's most celebrated heroes. Though not well known outside of his Clan, he is credited with reversing the slow decline of the Coyotes that followed their dominance after the invention of the OmniMech in the Golden Century.

Critically wounded during the Wars of Reaving, Han's survival was considered miraculous, as was his fast return to the battlefield. Earning the respect of his peers, Han was a natural choice for the khanship of the Clan when Khan Leo Koga died in a Trial defending the Coyotes' honor amongst the other Clans in the wake of the Society invasion.

Under Han's rule, the Coyotes were able to regain much of their lost standing in the eyes of their peers, though this came at the cost of becoming bitter enemies with Clan Blood Spirit. Seeing the Spirit's ever-shifting demands, Han lead a coalition of the remaining Home Clans to expel the Blood Spirits, exiling them to Colleen and the invasion corridor.

After a war to keep the Magistracy of Canopus out of the K-Cluster, Han decided that the Home Clans must invade the Inner Sphere, as it was clear that there was no way to keep the taint of the Inner Sphere away from their homes without conquest.

Leading the Coyotes, Stone Lions, Star Adders, and Cloud Cobras towards the Sphere, they were rebuffed by the juggernaut that was Clan Ghost Bear and it was made clear that they would not allow the Home Clans to pass through their space. This forced the Coyotes to retreat for a time but, undeterred, Han decided that they would instead travel through the invasion corridor and avoid Ghost Bear space.

This unfortunately meant pushing through the exiled Blood Spirits, and so Han started an invasion of their space. For the next three years, the Coyotes and Blood Spirits fought in a near standstill, neither Clan being able to make significant passage through the corridor. During this time, Han earned his lasting callsign of 'Iron Khan' for his determination to reach the Sphere. Eventually both Clans came to grudgingly respect one another, and slowly they began to co-operate to reach the Sphere. Eventually Han reached the space of the Hanseatic League only to discover that they had arrived too late and were now blockaded from entering the Near Periphery - once more by the Ghost Bears.

The Coyotes and Ghost Bears fought a brief war in the stars between the League and the Chainelane Isles, but ultimately the Coyotes were not able to match the Bears and all seemed lost for Han's quest.

However, it soon turned out that the Society was not as defeated as once thought, and it was revealed they had infiltrated the MRBC. As the Society's chaos swept through the Sphere, the Coyotes slipped into Davion space, eventually settling a sector of Periphery space near the Taurian Concordat. Relations between the Clan and House Davion quickly soured, and the Coyotes found themselves soon in battle against the Federated Suns.

Around this time, the Primus of ComStar and the Aurigan Coalition offered the Coyotes a chance to join the so-called 'New Star League'. With little to lose, Han chose to align himself with this new alliance and, by the war's end several years later, the Coyotes found themselves as one of the major Clans operating within the Sphere, second only to the irksome Ghost Bears.

Though the 'New Star League' fell apart in the years after the war, the Coyotes were well-positioned to dominate the area against their former allies, while a burgeoning alliance formed between Han and his former enemies in Clan Blood Spirit.

Never destined to become the ilKhan of the Clans, Han nonetheless represented the rebirth of his Clan and for decades to come, his influence was felt in the Kerensky Cluster as the Coyotes dominated it once more.
